Mantenha sempre um espaço de manobra adequado durante o voo 3. A velocidade de descida é muito elevada no Modo S 4. O sensor de Obstáculos é desactivado no Modo S. Maximum speed using Obstacle Sensing is %s. Forward Obstacle Sensing cameras have a 60º horizontal field of view and a 54º vertical field of view. Obstacles outside of these ranges will not be detected. Note: Forward Obstacle Sensing cameras do not operate at night or in low light. The accuracy of obstacle sensing depends on the obstacle size. Refer to the User Manual for more details. Turning off Forward Obstacle Sensing means the aircraft will not automatically avoid obstacles in its flight path. Turn off? After the motors start, release both control sticks. Check the aircraft’s status in the app. Wait until the app indicates Safe to Fly status. Pushing the left stick up and down controls the throttle. Push up to increase altitude and press down to decrease altitude. Pushing the left control stick left or right controls the aircraft’s yaw and rotation. Push it left to rotate counter-clockwise, push it right to rotate clockwise. Pushing the right control stick up and down controls the aircraft’s forward and backward motion. Pushing the stick left or right controls the aircraft’s left and right motion. When you turn the gimbal dial to the right the camera will shift to point upwards. When you turn the dial to the left, the camera will shift to point downwards. Toggle up or down to raise or lower the landing gear. Auto-takeoff and auto-land buttons in the DJI GO 4 app will automatically raise/lower the landing gear. To avoid camera damage, do not raise the landing gear when the aircraft is on the ground. Press and hold this button to start the RTH procedure. The RTH Button LED will blink white. The aircraft will then return to the most recently recorded Home Point. Press this button again to cancel the RTH procedure and regain control of the aircraft. (This tutorial is based on Mode 2 controls.) "To kiss every inch of ground, to feel every city's heart beating, and to thank every passer on my way." Not for a goal, but for feasting my eyes and heart! Love is to accompany, to tolerate, to take responsibility, and to stay by your side forever. All alone, and all along. Always on my way, and lost on my way . Free my heart, and free myself. Write my life and write my psalm. Travel, meeting myself. I have a dream. Journey from My Heart Love is all around. Never stop my steps. To turn on the aircraft, press the power button once, then press again and hold. Connect the remote controller by selecting its Wi-Fi Name in mobile device Wi-Fi settings. If your remote controller is not linked to the aircraft, tap Remote Controller Linking to start linking.  Remote Controller Linking LEDs Flashing Green: Linking Completo LEDs Flashing Red: Linking in Progress Turn on the aircraft. Press and hold the power button for about 6 seconds. Do not release until you hear the aircraft beep for twice. The aircraft will switch to Mobile Device Control Mode, and its Wi-Fi Name will reappear. This action will be ignored when your aircraft is in Mobile Device Control. Control Aircraft via Mobile Device "When your aircraft's front LEDs are flashing green, you have successfully enabled Mobile Device Control." Press and hold the aircraft power button for 9 seconds. Release when you hear the aircraft beep three times. Aircraft will switch to Mobile Device Control. Wi-Fi Name will appear again and the frequency will be changed to 2.4GHz. "When your aircraft's front LEDs are flashing green, you have successfully reset aircraft Wi-Fi." You can check default Wi-Fi Name and password in Battery compartments. Reset Aircraft Wi-Fi Name Reset Aircraft Wi-Fi Settings Password Wi-Fi Name Change Wi-Fi Name and password Remote Controller Linking  Turn on the aircraft. Press and hold the power button for about 3 seconds. Release when you hear the aircraft beep, and aircraft will start linking. The aircraft will finish linking within 30 seconds. Away and Follow The aircraft will fly backward and upward, then follow you. "1. Hold your open palm about 0.7 m in front of the aircraft, keeping your fingers together, and wave for 2 seconds. 2.When the Front LEDs flash green, aircraft will automatically fly 3 m backward and ascend 2.5 m. 3. Aircraft will then automatically enter Follow Mode. The front LEDs will turn green when Follow is successful. Use the Confirm Follow gesture if Follow fails." Note:Aircraft will then automatically enter Follow Mode. The front LEDs will turn green when Follow is successful. Use the Confirm Follow gesture if Follow fails. Beckon successful. Aircraft is returning. Beckon Put your hands and the aircraft will come back to you. "1. While the aircraft is following you, raise both your hands up with your fingers extended for 2 seconds. 2. The aircraft will first descend to about 1.5 m off the ground after successfully identifying your hands, then slowly fly to 1.2 m away. 3. Aircraft will constantly follow the subject until it is hovering. The front LEDs will turn red when Beckon stops." Confirm Follow Within identification range, the aircraft will start following you after you raise your arms. "1. To make the aircraft follow you, fly 2 m high and about 3 m to 10 m away. 2. Hold your hands up and open for about 2 seconds. 3. When Follow is successful, the front LEDs will turn green." Gesture in progress. PalmLand To PalmLand, put your hand under the aircraft. The aircraft will descend onto your palm and the propellers will stop rotating. "1. Stand in front of the aircraft, and put your hand below it within 0.5 m for 2 seconds. 2. The aircraft will check whether there is a human ahead and a hand is below. When both have been detected, aircraft will start to descend. 3. Propellers will stop rotating when aircraft lands to your palm." Note: Do not move your palm and keep it open as the aircraft is landing. Learn More 已开启近距离手势控制－不翻译 Selfie The aircraft will take a photo of you after you make a frame with your hands. "1. While the aircraft is within 7m away from you, make a frame with your hands. 2. The front LEDs will slowly flash red and initiate a 3-second countdown after recognition is successful. The front LEDs will flash red quickly when it is about to take a photo. The LEDs will go out for a short while the photo is being taken. " PalmControl Control the aircraft with your palm. "1. While keeping a safe distance between your palm and the aircraft, and slowly move your palm up or down to ascend or descend. 2. Stand in place and slowly rotate left or right to move the aircraft around you in a circle. 3. Slowly move forward or backward to fly forward or backward." Record Starting/Stopping Recording "1. While the aircraft flying within 6.5 ft (2 m) of you, put your arm up parallel to your body at an about 45° angle. 2. The front LEDs will flash red slowly and initiate a 3-second countdown after recognition is successful. The front LEDs will flash red quickly when it is about to record a video, and then the LEDs will go out when recording starts. 3. Repeating the gesture will stop recording, and the front LEDs will turn back on." Start/End PalmControl Tips for Starting or Ending PalmControl. "1. Hold your hand flat and keep fingers together for 2 seconds about 0.7 m in front of the aircraft. 2. When you have entered PalmControl, front LEDs will turn green. If they flash yellow quickly, please stand farther away or closer. 3. Quickly move your hand over your chest or put your hand down. PalmControl will end, and front LEDs will turn red." PalmControl enabled. PalmLaunch Take off from your palm, and the aircraft will hover in place. "1. Turn on your aircraft, place it on your palm with the camera facing toward you at eye level, double tap the power button, and aircraft will begin FaceAware. When FaceAware is successful, you will hear aircraft beep and see front LEDs turning green, then propellers will start rotating. 2. Do not release the aircraft until the front LEDs turn red. The aircraft will hover in place." Note: Make sure your fingers are under and away from the propellers when holding the aircraft.
